summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) staff discussing the review and potential release of documents, including Jeffrey Epstein's medical records, to The New York Times in the case Times v. BOP (Bureau of Prisons). The discussion centers on redaction protocols and production timing.

events.title: Document Production for Times v. BOP
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office coordinates the final review and production of documents, including Epstein's medical records, to The New York Times in response to the lawsuit Times v. BOP.

events.title: Reference to 'July 23 incident'
events.description: An email mentions that some of Epstein's medical records are directly related to an incident on July 23, which is likely a reference to his prior suicide attempt or injury in jail.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was reviewing Jeffrey Epstein's medical records for potential release to The New York Times, with a focus on records related to suicidality and the 'July 23 incident'.
The document production was part of the lawsuit 'Times v. BOP, 20-cv-833', indicating ongoing litigation by the media for access to records concerning Epstein's incarceration and death.
Internal debate centered on whether to disclose medical records unrelated to suicidality, with a settled position that such records were 'fine to produce'.
The email chain shows coordination between multiple AUSAs and mentions coverage arrangements for the case, indicating it was an active legal matter within the SDNY in August 2020.
